pull.title: test: Use the correct node for doubled keypath test
pull.body: #29124 had a silent merge conflict with #32350 which resulted in it using the wrong node. Fix the test to use the correct v22 node.

events.message: test: Use the correct node for doubled keypath test

lgtm ACK 32d55e28af69ef09094ba921289bf4d1ad79905a

I saw the silent merge conflict in the two pulls and wanted to mention it as soon as one gets merged, but it looks like both got merged at the same time.

ACK 32d55e28af69ef09094ba921289bf4d1ad79905a

Ah, I did message on [IRC yesterday](https://bitcoin-irc.chaincode.com/bitcoin-core-dev/2025-04-28#1116435;) to get #29124 merged because I realised there'd be conflicts when I was reviewing #32350. Looks like the latter got merged first.

Idk why the bot didn't add the "Needs rebase" tag on #29124 when the other got merged, I can see a gap of around an hour between the two merges. I'm sensing the CI runs tests after merges that takes some time for the bot to update open PRs with the required tags.

A silent merge conflict makes sense to me now.

Code Review ACK 32d55e28af69ef09094ba921289bf4d1ad79905a

Confirmed that `node 5(8-3)` with the correct configs for v22.0 is being used
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/65714c162c169cee7d95cf1fb2a9decfa8f9f9ad/test/functional/wallet_backwards_compatibility.py#L42
My bad for not running this test, thanks @achow101!
